body.p: When conducting a survey, which of the following is the most important reason to use a random sample?

input.choice: To avoid bias and to get a representative sample
So that we can make causal conclusions
To ensure truthful answers to the survey's questions

feedback.p: Correct. Random selection ensures that the sample is unbiased on average, so that the results of the study can be generalized to the population.
Incorrect. Random selection isnâ€™t what allows us to determine causation; that would be ensured only by random assignment to treatments.
Incorrect. The truthfulness of the subjects is not affected one way or the other by the way the subjects were selected.

body.p: When conducting a survey, which of the following is the most important reason to avoid using a volunteer sample?

input.choice: You might not get a significant result.
To ensure truthful answers to the survey's questions.
Your conclusions could not be reliably generalized to a larger population.
In order to get stronger opinions expressed.

feedback.p: Incorrect. There is no reason to assume that volunteer samples give answers that are more or less truthful than any other method.

Correct. The point of sampling is to be able to generalize about a larger population and volunteer samples do not represent the population as a whole since they tend to contain people with a strong enough opinion on the topic to call or write in and therefore are a biased sample.
Incorrect. Volunteer samples tend to contain responses from individuals who care the most about an issue and therefore have the strongest opinions.
